guitar

Class RightHand

  • java.lang.Object
    • guitar.RightHand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GuitarPlayerRightHand

    public class RightHand
extends java.lang.Object
implements GuitarPlayerRightHand
    Handles the right hand actions of the guitar. Right hand deals with creating the noise with plucking and strumming.
    Author:
    brandonandre

    • Constructor Detail

      • RightHand

        public RightHand(Guitar guitar)
        Constructor. Passes the guitar which is stored into the program to run the functions the right hand needs to take care of.
        Parameters:
        guitar - Passes the guitar you want the right hand to be attached too.

    • Method Detail

      • pluck

        public void pluck(int... wires)
        Plucks the specific cables given. Depending on the amount of cables passed through it, it will play each one. Note that it will play it instantly one after the other.
        Specified by:
        pluck in interface GuitarPlayerRightHand
        Parameters:
        wires - using a variable length argument list, you can set as many specific cables as you want.

      • strum

        public void strum()
        Triggers all of the wires from 6 to 1. Therefore plucking every single wire with a 80 millisecond pause in between each pluck.
        Specified by:
        strum in interface GuitarPlayerRightHand

      • strum

        public void strum(int wireNum)
        Triggers all of the wires from a number you specifically want to 1. Therefore plucking every single wire from the specific one you selected, down to 1 with a 80 millisecond pause in between each pluck.
        Specified by:
        strum in interface GuitarPlayerRightHand

      • pause

        public void pause(int milliSeconds)
        Causes the thread to sleep for a specific amount of milliseconds.
        Specified by:
        pause in interface GuitarPlayerRightHand
        Parameters:
        milliSeconds - Amount of time to pause in milliseconds.
